phrase.item: A golden hen
Once upon a time there was a king.
The king had three daughters.
He said,
"I will let my daughters marry those who have their houses inside the river."
"Inside the river should be all kinds of fishes."
A young man came and told the king, "I want you to go with me, my house is inside the river."
"In the river there are all kinds of fishes."
The kind did not believe him and said that there was a person who had a house inside the river.
The king went to check and it was true.
Then he agreed to let him marry his pampered daughter and celebrated for seven nights and days.
After a while the girl's grandmother came to visit her.
Then she asked her granddaughter, "How did your husband build this house?"
The girl did not pay attention to her.
The next day she asked again, "Ask your husband, how did he build this house?"
She told her grandmother, "He wouldn't tell me the story."
One time when her husband came from work she asked him the question, but her husband did not respond and changed the subject.
The next day her grandmother asked her again, "How did your husband build this house?"
Her granddaughter replied, "My husband didn't answer me, he kept it a secret from me".
Her grandmother said, "This time, when your husband comes, pretend to be sad",
"Do not talk to him."
"If your husband asks you why you are sad, say nothing, just be quiet."
"When he asks you again, ask him how he built this house".
The grandmother left and when the man came [he saw] that his wife was sad.
Then he asked her, "Why are you sad?"
His wife didn't talk to him.
Her husband said, "Don't make me upset," and she asked him, "How did you make this house?"
Her husband told her, "I made it with the golden hen."
She asked again, "How did you make it with the golden hen?"
He replied, "I clean the golden hen and hold it in my armpit."
The man left in the morning and the old woman came again.
She said, "Did you ask or not?"
She told her everything that her husband had told her.
Then her grandmother asked again, "Where is the golden hen?"
She replied, "On the shelf!"
The old woman sat there for a while and then stole the golden hen and left the house quickly.
The lady's husband came from work and [saw] that his golden hen was not there.
He asked his wife, "Where is the golden hen?"
His wife looked for it for a while and said, "Maybe my grandmother stole it?"
The man had a cat and he told him, "Go and bring my golden hen from the old woman's house."
The golden hen was in a cradle.
The cat pulled it out of the cradle and brought it to the man.
Then their life got better again.
